{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Netgear |model=WN2000RPT |revision=v1 |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=05/15/2008 |manuf_country=China |manuf=Delta Networks |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=repeater,bridge |fcc_id=PY308200083 |ic_id=4054A-08200083 |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Atheros |cpu1_model=AR9130 |cpu1_cspeed=400 |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1=4 |fla1_brand=Macronix |fla1_model=MX25L3206EMI-12G |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1=32 |ram1_brand=Nanya |ram1_model=NT5DS16M16CS-5T |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial=J1 (115200 8N1) |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi1_chip1_model=AR9130 |wi1_chip2_brand=Atheros |wi1_chip2_model=AR9102 |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Atheros |sw_model=AR8216 |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports= |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bgn |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui=A0:21:B7,C4:3D:C7,E0:91:F5 |oui_eth=A0:21:B7,C4:3D:C7,E0:91:F5 }} ''Universal WiFi Range Extender'' {{TechInfoDepot|Netgear_WN2000RPT}}
[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?p=490322 On the DD-WRT forums] :"2976343500" is silkscreened on the board. Per [http://www.wifinetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-reviews/31318-netgear-wn2000rpt-universal-wifi-range-extender-reviewed SmallNetBuilder's review] and router tables, this device shares the same FCC ID as the [[Netgear WNR2000v1]] (PY308200083). SmallNetBuilder also states the device uses the AR8236 switch.. but the Netgear WNR2000v1 uses the AR8216 switch. The device is actually based on an AR9130 rev2 SoC and an AR8216 switch chip as it has been verified using information queried from hardware registers.
